chapter.title: What's new in Spring Integration 4.2?
chapter.para: This chapter provides an overview of the new features and improvements that have been introduced with Spring Integration 4.1. If you are interested in more details, please see the Issue Tracker tickets that were resolved as part of the 4.1 development process.

section.title: Major JMX Rework
section.para: A new MetricsFactory strategy interface has been introduced. This, together with other changes in the JMX infrastructure provides much more control over JMX configuration and runtime performance.
However, this has some important implications for (some) user environments.

section.title: Wire Tap
section.para: As an alternative to the existing selector attribute, the <wire-tap/> now supports the selector-expression attribute.

section.title: File Outbound Channel Adapter
section.para: The <int-file:outbound-channel-adapter> and <int-file:outbound-gateway> now support an append-new-line attribute. If set to true, a new line is appended to the file after a message is written. The default attribute value is false.

section.title: Class Package Change
section.para: The ScatterGatherHandler class has been moved from the org.springframework.integration.handler to the org.springframework.integration.scattergather.

section.title: TCP Serializers
section.para: The TCP Serializers no longer flush() the OutputStream; this is now done by the TcpNxxConnection classes. If you are using the serializers directly within user code, you may have to flush() the OutputStream.

section.title: Server Socket Exceptions
section.para: TcpConnectionServerExceptionEvents are now published whenever an unexpected exception occurs on a TCP server socket (also added to 4.1.3, 4.0.7). See for more information.

section.title: @InboundChannelAdapter
section.para: Previously, the @Poller on an inbound channel adapter defaulted the maxMessagesPerPoll attribute to -1 (infinity). This was inconsistent with the XML configuration of <inbound-channel-adapter/>s, which defaults to 1. The annotation now defaults this attribute to 1.
